column1: The House of Isildur were the descendants of Isildur
column2: elder son of Elendil. The House came close to destruction at the beginning of the Third Age

column2: Isildur and Anárion founded the two Númenóreans realms in exile: Arnor and Gondor.  Elendil was the High King of all of the Dúnedain but the rule of the southern kingdom of Gondor was delegated to joint ruled under his sons.  After the War of the Last Alliance of Elves and Men both Elendil and Anárion were dead
column3: so Isildur became the new High King.  When he left Gondor to take up his kingship in Arnor he delegated rule of Gondor to Anárion’s son
column5: Isildur and his first three sons perished in the Disaster of the Gladden Fields.  From that time forward the two realms were sundered
column6: with the Kings of Gondor descending from the House of Anárion and the Kings of Arnor descending from the House of Isildur.
